newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian Oct CPI seen at 3.0 pct yr/yr--analysts.
newsitem.headline: Italian Oct CPI seen at 3.0 pct yr/yr--analysts.

text.p: Italian consumer prices are seen at 3.0 percent year-on-year in October and 0.1 month-on-month after data issued by all 10 sample cities.
Final Italian CPI stood at 3.4 percent year-on-year and rose 0.3 percent on a month-on-month basis in September.
Milan, Turin and Trieste announced their preliminary CPI data on Monday, while Bologna, Venice, Trieste, Perugia, Genoa, Naples and Palermo published their figures on Tuesday.
The 10 cities have a combined weighting of 69.8 percent on the total index.
Final official inflation data for October will be issued by national statistics institute Istat on November 6.
On Monday, after the figures from the first three cities analysts forecast October CPI at 3.1 percent year-on-year and 0.2 percent month-on-month.
